qas.question: What is no different between online pharmacies and community pharmacies?

context: Since <a0_0><b5_0>about the year <a0_1><a0_2>2000<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, a growing number of Internet pharmacies have been established worldwide. Many of these pharmacies are similar to community pharmacies, and in fact, many of them are actually operated by <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>brick-and-mortar community pharmacies<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/> that serve consumers online and those that walk in their door<a1_0/>. The primary difference is <a4_0><a4_2><b9_0>the <a4_1>method by which the medications are requested and received<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>. Some customers consider this to be <a3_2>more convenient and private method<a3_2/> rather than traveling to a community drugstore where <a3_0><b8_0>another customer might overhear about the drugs that they take<b8_0/><a3_0/>. Internet pharmacies (also known as <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>online pharmacies<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>) are also recommended to some patients by their physicians if they are <a3_1>homebound<a3_1/>.
